title: Why was Joker 2 such a huge flop? Now Lady Gaga reports
text:
Joker 2 was and is a flop across the board. The ratings for the sequel of the controversial original are underground. And while in the Hollywood dream factory, you prefer to look towards the pick -up result, you should react similarly shocked here.
According to Variety, Warner Bros. could with the sequel between $ 150 and $ 200 million have banished. But how could the joker (Buy now € 14.19 now ))) please Dramatically fail in the cinema ? Reason enough to ask Lady Gaga personally.
When did Joker 2 come to the cinema? In Germany Joker 2 on October 3, 2024 celebrated his debut on the big screen. As soon as the film started, the project turned out to be a cinematic handle in the toilet. On the part of the fan base, you hardly let and leave a good hair on the apparently hoseboths.

These days have the Pop icon the website Elle gave a detailed interview. Of course, the conversation is not just about your bumpy experiment in the category. You can find the complete interview both here as well as linked to the sources below. Here Lady Gaga is asked about the film disaster.
Why was Joker 2 a flop? The musician's answer is almost philosophically simple, albeit a little clumsy. “ Sometimes people just don't like some things “According to their classification.” It's that simple. And I think to be an artist, you have to accept that people [deine Kunst] sometimes don't like. You just keep going, even if something didn't click the way you imagined it. “
From the perspective of art enthusiasts, Lady Gaga should be right with her clear announcement. If you assess Joker 2 as a product, the analysis at Warner Bros. should be much more detailed.
Even before the theatrical release, it was clear that we would not see a third part of Todd Phillips and his team. Now the question arises much more about which course you can basically With the brand Want to go, keyword DCU . At least Batman seems to look optimistically into the future with series projects and blockbusters.
